description: DEMOLITION OF EXISTING GARAGE INVOLVING THE REMOVAL OF TWO TREES, AND ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY OUTBUILDING WITH DECKING AREA.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Arboricultural Report 11/09/2019; PL_PR_1001; PL_PR_2001, PL_PR_2002, PL_PR_2003, PL_PR_3001.

Condition : 3 - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Access to the flat roof of the proposed pavilion building hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 5 - The details and measures for the protection of the existing trees as specified in the 'Arboricultural Report' dated '11th September 2019' shall be complied with. The methods for protection of the existing trees shall fully accord with all of the measures specified in the report and shall be installed prior to commencement of any site works and shall remain in place until the conclusion of all site works.

Condition : 6 - The approved development shall be constructed using a pile and beam foundation. No work, other than demolition of the existing garage, shall be commenced until details of the proposed design, materials and method of construction are submitted to and approved in writing by the LPA and the work shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 7 - Site supervision: The details of the approved 'Arboricultural Report' shall include the retention of an arboricultural expert to monitor and report to the LPA not less than monthly the status of all tree works and tree protection measures throughout the course of the demolition and site works. A final Certificate of Completion shall be submitted to the LPA at the conclusion of all site works.
Condition : 8 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposes incidental to the residential use of the dwelling known as 19 Sheridan Road, SW19 3HW.

Condition : 9 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.
   ii) The application was accompanied with further supporting documentation and is now considered an acceptable scheme.
   iii) The application was approved with an agreement to an extension of time.
